bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, October 26, 1900
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D DEC 8 '00 DEPT OF STATE
Copy to Mr referring to his letters of Sept 12 & 17 & the Dept reply of Sept 28 1900

div1.p: No. 51. Consular. Legation of the United States. Monrovia Liberia, Oct. 26, 1900.

p.add: Aus. by form to Hon. C. E. Littlefeild Dec 13, 1900. further acknowledged December 31st 1900 see his to. 52

div1.p: Hon. David J Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.
Subject. Receipt of correspondence, relative to the Estate of the late Anranus M. Miller, at Harper, Maryland Co. Liberia
No. 51. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Oct. 26 1900.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have to acknowledge the receipt Oct. 25, 1900, of your No. 53 Sept. 26, 1900, Dip Series, with 5 enclosures, relative to the estate of the late Anranus M. Miller, deceased March 1890, at Harper, (Cape Palmas) Maryland County Liberia.

In reply I have the honor to say that the records and files of this Legation are being searched as fast as possible, for any an all correspondence, between this Legation and the State and other Departments,

Departments, here; the widow and other heirs at law in America, as well as other parties consulted with said correspondence, here, and elsewhere. In connection, herewith, I have to inform you that R. H. Gibson, whose letter of August 21, 1891, to Mrs. E. A. Miller, was an enclosure, died at Harper, (Cape Palmas) May 28, 1900.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith M. R. and C. General.
